intro: Pentacalia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Pentacalia ochracea is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand saline and drought conditions.
